intro: Hieracium armerioides subsp. armerioides, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm and features basal rosettes of dark green, hairy leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in branched inflorescences, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. It has a taproot system and is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and open habitats. This species is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides.
